speaker.whotheyare: Jennifer Aaker is a behavioral scientist focused on understanding what creates meaning vs. happiness in life.
speaker.whylisten: Jennifer Aaker is General Atlantic Professor and Coulter Family Fellow at the Stanford Graduate School of Business and a leading expert on how purpose and meaning shape individual choices -- and how technology can positively impact both personal well-being and company growth. Her work has been widely published in leading scientific journals and featured in The Economist, New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Atlantic and Science. Most recently, she coauthored the national bestseller Humor, Seriously: Why Humor Is a Secret Weapon in Business (and Life). Recently named MBA Professor of the Year, Aaker counts winning a dance-off in the early 1980s among her greatest feats.
